bug.short_desc: qx.ui.form.List.findItemByLabelFuzzy causes error "method getLabel() not defined"

long_desc.thetext:
We sometimes get the error "method getLabel() not defined" which is caused by the method qx.ui.form.List.findItemByLabelFuzzy. This error shows up if the user presses a key while the keyboard focus is on a list.
We are using ListItem's that inherit from qx.ui.core.Widget. These custom list items are added by calling the method qx.ui.form.List.add(LayoutItem child, Map options?)
The problem is that the method findItemByLabelFuzzy tries to call the method getLabel(), which is not defined.
The Qooxdoo api does not inform the programmer that ListItem's have to implement the method getLabel(), because the add()-method accepts everything that inherits from LayoutItem. The LayoutItem does not have a method getLabel().
Therefore I would suggest that the method findItemByLabelFuzzy checks if the method getLabel() is defined before this method is called.
